title: IOI to acquire Cremer’s oleochemicals business in Germany
text:
IOI to acquire Cremer’s oleochemicals business in Germany 11 September 2015 
Malaysian conglomerate IOI Corporation has signed an agreement to acquire Cremer Oleo's oleochemicals business in Germany for €89.4m. 
The acquisition includes two production facilities in Germany, in Wittenberge, Brandenburg, Witten, North Rhine-Westphalia. 
The Witten plant offers branded oleochemical specialty products for pharmaceutical, cosmetic, food and performance chemicals market. The Wittenberge facility provides capacities for esterification with multi-step short-path distillation, distillation and fractionation of fatty acids, producing medium-chain triglycerides. "The facilities have a combined processing capacity of around 39,200t a year.." 
The facilities have a combined processing capacity of around 39,200t a year. 
IOI plans to use internally generated funds and bank borrowings to finance the acquisition. 
The acquisition will help the company accelerate investments in more specialised downstream oleochemical manufacturing, and expand its oleochemicals division into new product range to penetrate pharmaceutical, cosmetic, food and performance chemicals markets worldwide. 
IOI expects the deal to have no impact on the issued and paid-up share capital and substantial shareholders' shareholdings. 
There would also be no material effect on the earnings and earnings per share for the financial year ending 30 June 2016, the company said. 
Subject to approval of the shareholders and regulatory consent, the deal is likely to conclude by the first quarter of calendar year 2016. 
Established in 1946, Cremer produces and distributes basic oleochemical products with presence in more than 30 countries worldwide. Follow Us:
